text.section: The Company is not subject to Title 11 of this article.

The Board shall:
adopt a schedule of premium rates in accordance with sound actuarial practices; and
ensure that the rates are not excessive, inadequate, or unfairly discriminatory.

section.section:
The Board shall determine the schedule of premium rates by:
classifying all of the policyholders of the Company on the basis of the respective level of hazard of their enterprises; and
setting a premium rate for each class on the basis of:

To determine the schedule of premium rates, the Board shall use the rating system that, in the opinion of the Board:
most accurately measures the level of hazard for each policyholder on the basis of the number of injuries that occur in the enterprises of the policyholder;
encourages the prevention of injuries; and
ensures the solvency of the Company from year to year.
The Board may set minimum premium rates for policies issued by the Company.

text.section: The Commissioner shall review the Company's rates as part of an examination under § 2-205 of this article to determine whether the Company's rate making practices produce actuarially sound rates.
